intro: Ferula neapolitana, commonly known as the Naples cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces a strong, aromatic scent, which is attributed to its essential oils. Ferula neapolitana is often found in dry, rocky soils and can thrive in Mediterranean climates. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
